content: अपस् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [आप् असुन् थस्वश्च; आपःकर्माख्यायां थस्वो नुट्च वा स्यात् <ls>Uṇ. 4. 207.</ls> अप्नः, अपः] {@--1@} Work, action; अपसा संतु नेमे <ls>Rv. 1. 54. 8.</ls> {@--2@} Sacred act or rite, sacrificial work. {@--3@} Water. {%--<ab>a.</ab>%} (अपाः) {@--1@} Active, engaged in any act (कर्मयुक्त). {@--2@} Got or obtained. According to <ls>B. and R.</ls> अपसः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} <ab>pl.</ab> stands in the Veda for (1) the hands and fingers busy in kindling the sacred fire and performing the sacrificial rites; (2) the three goddesses of sacred speech or the three divinities, fire, wind and sun; and (3) the active or running waters. [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>L.</ab> {%opus%}.]
